summary: Human trafficking victims are often held in slave-like conditions and forced to work in areas such as the commercial sex trade, factories, and agriculture. The Departments of State and Labor, and the U.S. Agency for International Development managed 120 counter-trafficking projects in FY 2017. These projects were carried out by grantees and others, and overseen by the agencies. We found some weaknesses in State’s and...
title: Human Trafficking: State and USAID Should Improve Their Monitoring of International Counter-trafficking Projects
